p:
We then performed SNP Effect Concordance analysis (SECA) for the corroborated findings from the PRS-based analyses. In SECA ( http://neurogenetics.qimrberghofer.edu.au/SECA; see ref.
70 for more details), association results rather than individual genotyped data are analyzed to test for genetic pleiotropy (the same SNPs affecting both traits) and concordance (the agreement in SNP effect directions across both traits) between two genetically determined traits.
